cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, forecast to cross the northeast Gulf toward Florida’s Big Bend then move quickly off the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to the South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf coast) and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL (Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend, then the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Monday afternoon and evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft possible in Tampa Bay with locally higher pockets, leading to minor coastal flooding at Port Manatee wharves
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches, producing ponding on dock surfaces and reduced visibility
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday; rough seas and dangerous surf reducing vessel traffic safety
